review_title: A movie unique in its essence !! (may contain spoilers)
see it for the songs and deepika
A real Masala Movie at last!!!
review_detailed_main:
This one is very much for Filmi Fans... it's not an art movie and definitely not pretending to be one. Ignore the bad reviews you might find from more high-brow bollywood-watchers because this film delivers exactly what it promises. A roller-coaster ride with action, drama, romance, (deliberately) hammy acting and a very sweet fairytale-ish story.

Look, if you want to enjoy it as much as I did you might need my severe gullibility and suspension of disbelief, so realists beware! But this is what makes Indian cinema so special to me - three hours of full-on entertainment. The Badshah rocks and new girl Deepika is charming as the ''dreamy girl''. The supporting cast do a really great job as well with Arjun Rampal doing a wonderful turn as the villain (and if I ever see him in the street I'll probably give him a proper kick to the crotch). The cinematography is fantastic and it took all my self-control not to get up and dance in the isles during the song sequences. Yes, its a spoof, but a good-natured one at that (it's really nice to see that the actors can take the mickey of themselves).

The King Khan still reigns!!! and My Filmi of the Year!!!

First of all I am not a fan of Shahrukh Khan and sometime admitting this fact is considered to be offensive; anyways lets talk about Om Shanti Om. The movie taken me by surprise; I had no expectation still brought DVD to add it to my new Bollywood Movies collection and started watching it on weekend sipping tea before going to bath ...I was just waiting for that usual bore moment to stop the movie and take a shower....but I surprisingly completed the whole movie before shower. There are some moments where it feels like dragging but still movie has great music and that let you remain seated. Story is typical incarnation stuff that we seen in yesteryear movies; even old dialogs used in the movie looks very funny. Shahrukh has done a tremendous job and I liked his energy in the movie; especially the South Indian actor role he done was well made and shows the much misunderstood lighter side of it. Other actors also performed well like the main actress Deepika and Shreyas Talpade is great. Arjun Rampal is good as usual.

Had there been new story when all the movie set and costumes are shown of 70s then it would not have been a good movie....so I think people watching the movie knew from start what is coming next and that is the strength of the movie and Farah Khan did the great job by showing us the things differently; the Manoj Kumar part was not funny though. The twist or lack of there of was taken from Madhumati and make sense for a good ending...but second part is not made in style and the revenge element is visible enough to eat up the whole humor and we knew where the movie is moving now...

Still great movie, old style set and more closer look to the life of people behind and front of the camera....I would give this movie 6 out of 10 overall and can say that it is watchable even if you don't want to spend sometime before shower..

review_title: OSO: best review I have read...
review_detailed_main:
Even if one doesn't compare OSO to Karz, OSO comes up short! It pleases the NRI population that has only seen 6 Hindi films till date, and all of them are either Yash Chopra-SRK or Karan Johan-SRK films! It's obvious that they will like the movie as they've not had the opportunity to watch better Hindi Cinema. SRK is their world! The other segment it is targeted at is the teenyboppers or the masses that admire SRK for being a self-made star! They too know very little about good Hindi cinema to realize that they're being served sub-standard fare! Movies & actors that deserve a dekko are Seher & Arshad Warsi! OSO has SRK hamming to the hilt! His characters are playful but there is no effort at making them seem believable. Deepika is beautiful and seems to have transitioned well from looking good to emoting.

Farah & SRK are worshippers of the mainstream masala commercial Bollywood file? Fine! But they must do justice to the moviegoer & not insult his intelligence. OSO insults the intelligence of the moviegoer with SRK hamming in all the scenes.

Main Hoon Na to was an over the top masala film, but at least the overall product was believable. It entertained & didn't take the viewer for granted. OSO does & therefore disappoints! There is a better review of this film than mine. Here it is: http://greatbong.net/2007/11/12/om-shanti-om-the-review/

review_title: What a delight, just pure entertainment
review_detailed_main:
Om Shanti Om is clearly an extremely meta film, and as a newbie to the films of Bollywood, many of the references and guest appearances were lost on me. Ordinarily, I think I would be annoyed by a movie making me feel like an outsider looking in, but there's so much more to this movie than just references and knowing winks at the audience. The movie is hilarious in the way the jokes are constructed, and that the movie and actors in it are willing to laugh at themselves a little. This film has a great cast, and I like how they know when they don't have to be subtle with a joke. Some of them are almost Monty-Python levels of over-the-top and I was laughing right along with it. The other thing I loved about the script was all the blatant foreshadowing that they lay out for the audience, and everything they set up pays off in a satisfying way. They do this on many levels including when they start to blur the lines between what is happening in the main plot and what happens in the movies within the movie.

From what I understand, most Bollywood films include some good song-and-dance numbers, and Om Shanti Om definitely delivered when it came to the tunes. I was tapping my toes, singing along, and having a joyous time as I watched the elaborate sets, costumes, and choreography that went into each number. I was so captivated, that when they played the titular song in the score later in the film, I was still humming along and singing the lyrics in my head. What's truly wonderful about Om Shanti Om is that it has all the things I've mentioned (music, smart scripting, comedy, and an abundance of meta references) but it also has a wonderful love story, and revenge plot, too. I am a sucker for a good romance, and I liked how this movie developed the relationship more than simply having it be a love-at-first-sight kind of thing. As you can tell, I found Om Shanti Om a joy from start to finish. I can come up with a nitpick or two when I really think about it, so it won't instantly become an all-time favorite, but I don't want to dwell on the negatives because the whole film-watching experience was such a good time.

review_title: Om Shanti Om is a story of love and betrayal
review_detailed_main: Om Shanti Om is a story of love and betrayal Om Shanti Om is a story of a person who makes his dreams come true and becomes a successful actor. Om Shanti Om is also a love story of a popular actress and her fan. It is a story of a fan who does everything to protect his favorite actress from all kind of trouble and even after that actresses murder, does all that he can to give her justice. Nice combination of all these different stories, making it a little longer to 3 hours. Songs, lyrics and music of this film deserve a huge applause because this is the thing which adds more value to the story. Each of the songs in the film are so beautiful that they can either touch you or take you to an imaginary romantic world. All the actors did a good job. The use of too many stars in the award function sequence is one thing that will surely go down in history. Prominent faces right from the yesteryears till today were shown in that particular song sequence. The effort to bring them all together in one sequence one by one needs to be commended. Of all the different stories I have mentioned above in the introduction, two particular stories really tried to impress me: one of the popular actress and fan. Second:a person following his dreams and becoming successful actor. One of my favorite dialogues from the film, 'kisi cheez ko dil se chaho ... to puri kainaat usse tumse milane ki koshish mein lag jaati hai'. Very motivational message. Simple dialogue but has deeper meaning. This film has everything: comedy, love, action and drama. This picture has all different type of emotions, happy, sad etc whatnot. One needs to surely watch this film. He/she will like it. Special shoutout needs to go for the makers for showing faces of all the staff of this film, right from producer, director to lightman, dressman, spotboy. Usually not seen in movies. Good thought.

If you're not Indian or a fan of Indian cinema you might wonder what Bollywood is. If you ever wondered what the fuss is all about you should watch this.

It's not acknowledged as a classic Bollywood movie but it is possibly the most accessible one to introduce non-Indians to this rich and amazing genre. As with lots of Bollywood movies, it's a love story, it's an over the top melodrama with more cliches than you knew actually existed, It's got every emotion, every passion, lust, revenge, an evil baddie, a handsome hero and a beautiful damsel in distress.

What doesn't quite work are the comedy parts. Every country has its own different sense of humour so English viewers might find the humour a little unsophisticated. The supposedly funny section is only at the beginning so you've just got to get over that first 30 minutes.

The story is again a popular Bollywood trope: reincarnation but Farah Khan, choreographer turned director turns what ostensibly sounds like a silly story into something amazing. It's completely watchable and thoroughly engaging thanks to a big part by the two stars. Shah Rukh Khan, THE Bollywood megastar shows why he's the highest paid actor in the world and Deepika Padukone shows why she is unquestionably the most beautiful woman in the world.

You will enjoy this.

review_title: Most Senseless Movie of the Decade!
review_detailed_main:
How many movies you've seen have been very unrealistically unbelievable? This movie is easily and most definitely the most senseless movie you would ever see. It will blow your mind to pieces, for it has not even a hint of reason.

Let me tell you this unbelievable story, It is a story of a junior artist Om Prakash Makhija(Shahrukh Khan) who wants to become a lead actor. He loves the top actress Shanti Priya, played by Deepika Padukone, and wants to marry her. Om once saves Shanti Priya from a fire accident during the shooting, and in the process develops a friendship with her. Shanti Priya is already in love with a big Producer, and becomes pregnant from him. But this big producer guy does not want to marry this woman(Shanti Priya) anymore, and there ensues a big emotional argument, Producer then burns her to death, and Om who has been silently watching this argument tries to save her and in the process dies himself.

Then the second part, Om Prakash Makhija is born again as Om Kapoor, son of a superstar, and a superstar himself.And there is a person who just looks like Shanti Priya, but is not her reincarnation. Om Prakash Makhija's mother then sees Om Kapoor accidentally and thinks that her son is reincarnate, and goes to him and tells about his past reincarnation, then Om Kapoor gets memory of his past birth, and then Om Kapoor, his mother, his friend of past birth(who never ages), and Shanti Priya look alike set to extract revenge from this Producer. Then rest of story ensures ridiculousness in high amount, and we end up becoming confused.

The songs, dances, are intermixed in the movie to produce an horrible effect. Too much sentiment is packed in the movie. There is nothing much in the movie other than Shahrukh Khan's 6 pack, Deepika's Amazing body. Direction, Story, and various other departments fail miserably.What makes this movie so unbelievable are the scenes, the logic, and the most unnatural characters. No depth at all, it does not look like a standard movie made for world audiences, rather looks like a movie made to impress mental patients.Shahrukh Khan is a good actor, and we cannot bear him wasting his talents in a garbage like this.

Don't watch it unless you want to become insane!!!!

I'm rating this after 14 years too (while watching) , because this film never gets old. One of my most favourite movies of all time. When I watched it in 2007, I was a teenager. Not many movies can withstand the test and taste of time.

Like most movies he's in, SRK carries this film on the power of his charm. This is not to say the plot is weak, but unless they're an old Bollywood film buff, the storyline, parodies and references are unlikely to have an impact on the viewer. If they are though, they're in for a treat. This movie is comic, emotional, nostalgic and heartfelt all at the same time. It is best described as a period-fantasy love drama.

There are two reasons this film is remembered for today - one, for being Deepika Padukone's debut (surprisingly impressive), and second, for being pitted against Saawariya in a now regrettably ugly campaign as both films were being released on the same day. To be frank, I love both films now but back in the day I couldn't look past the tragic beauty of Saawariya which I saw first and so I couldn't appreciate Om Shanti Om for the beautiful film it is.

Firstly, the acting from the entire cast - including SRK, Deepika Padukone, Arjun Rampal, Kirron Kher, Shreyas Talpade is commendable. I especially loved the chemistry between Talpade and SRK. The music is wonderful and each song is memorable. The costumes, sets and production design made me feel nostalgic for a time period I didn't even exist in. My biggest issue is the length and editing of the film, but one can also argue that the whole vengeance subplot wouldn't have felt earned otherwise. Then there are also a few jokes I felt weren't in good humour as they involved some real people. But overall, a wholesome tribute to the quintessential Bollywood masala film genre.

review_title: Om Shanti Om- Farah Khan you have a winner on your hands again
review_detailed_main:
When I heard about Om Shanti Om I thought that Farah Khan wouldn't be able to match the success to Main Hoon Na. I was proved wrong and I would was bowled over by this movie. The film was a remake of the 80's blockbuster Karz (coincidentally Om Shanti Om was a song from that movie). Karz director Subhash Ghai and hero Rishi Kapoor even had special appearances in this movie. Directed by good friend Farah Khan and produced by wife Gauri this is a Shah Rukh Khan film from the minute go till the end.

Shah Rukh Khan was fantastic and Deepika provided good support, Arjun Rampal however wasn't good in his role. Om Shanti Om pokes fun at the film industry. The songs were fabulous, especially Dard-e Disco and Dewaangi, where over 30 film stars make special appearances. The ending was brilliant, there is even a twist at the end. Om Shanti Om was fun all the way. Subhash Ghai should be proud to call Om Shanti Om a remake of his movie.

review_title: Another As Usual SRK Flick ...Nothing Special
One of the best films you will ever watch!
review_detailed_main: If you are a fan of entertainment and great cinema (not to be confused with artsy cinema), then this is the perfect title for you. The director, Farah Khan, has done it again! She has made one of the most enjoyable movies of our times. If you are not familiar with Bollywood, then this is the movie to start with. If you are a Bollywood fan, I don't even think I need to say more. Chances are you have watched it and loved it. The film doesn't take itself too seriously and is just pure, fun movie. Also, watch "Karz" if you haven't. You'll see what I mean as I don't want to give anything away. For the non-Bollywoodites...watch for the title track "Om Shanti Om". Big hit in India but also resonates with Westerners. Do I recommend this film? More than probably any other film I can. (Yes, even more than "Main Hoon Naa" - another blockbuster and masterpiece from Farah Khan). Now go watch the film and thank me for suggesting/recommending!

Wow!! that was an awful waste of time and thank goodness, i did NOT waste my money on this pathetic movie. The most disappointing factor of this movie is Shah Rukh Khan's acting. The first half of his Om Prakash portrayal was tolerable...but what happened to Om Kapoor? Why is he so pathetic. Acting was immeasurably annoying...too over-dramatic, gee, there's a limit to what one can take. It's just disgusting seeing such a well-established, sophisticated, mature actor...trying to look all swell like Salman or whoever but looking completely foolish. Why can't he just be a natural actor and not try to be like someone else for God sake. Moreover, the movie was fully predictable, exaggerated performances (can't figure out whether that was Farah's intention), a total masala movie, a dis to ones intelligence and a complete mockery of the Indian Cinema.

I believe the only reasons to why it gained tremendous fame at the box-office are because of the countless star appearances and of course, SRK-FK pair. Otherwise i find no other reasons to why the movie is empowering the rest. However, I didn't expect much from Farah as a director but I did expect quite a lot more from SRK as an ACTOR. In the end, we always count on the actor, sometimes not taking much account of the direction.

Therefore, I would not recommend anyone to watch this movie if you're looking for some intense performances or a good story. But if you're willing to take the risk, then do so. Or unless you're an ardent fan of SRK and Farah, then there's no one stopping you.

review_title: One of The Best Movies For This Year
review_detailed_main:
This is the second movie with Shah Rukh "King" Khan that has been a tremendous hit, the other being "Chak De India." "Om Shanti Om," the title based on the early 1980's song from Subash Ghai's "Karz," has Om, a junior artist in the 1970's Bollywood who has dreams of becoming a star. He then meets the well known actress, Shantipriya and falls in love with her. But then tragedy strikes and he finds out that Shantipriya is pregnant by the man who had introduced her into the movie industry - Mukesh Mehra, who will stop at nothing to continue with his career and will not allow anyone to destroy it. The movie stars Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika, Kirron Kher, Arjun Rampal and Shreyas Talwade and the Pakistani actor / Director, Javed Sheikh and Bindu.

Directed by Farah Khan, the opening sequence, consists of the song "Om Shanti Om" from the movie "Karz" and a very young Rishi Kapoor can be seen in the song along with the Director of the movie, Subash Ghai. Shah Rukh is just fantastic in his role as "Om." Deepika, considering that this is her first Hindi movie, has also performed well, as have Kirron Kher, Shreyas Talwade and Arjun Rampal. The seventies era has been superbly re - created by Farah Khan and the Producer Gauri Khan. In one scene a very young and romantic Rajesh Khanna can be seen. Since this is based on movies and acting, naturally, Farah Khan has kept it as realistic as possible by including scenes involving the Filmfare awards and the party that normally follows its. This also means that various Directors and actors also make an appearance - Yash Chopra, Karan Johar, Subash Ghai, Rakesh Roshan and Hrithik Roshan, Amitabh and Abhishek Bachchan,Shilpa Shetty, Kajol, Rani Mukherjee, Juhi Chawla just to mention a few. And yes, Shah Rukh "King" Khan does show his "six pack" by removing his shirt in a song. In terms of Box office takings, it is estimated that this has earned three quarters of a million pounds in the first week in the United Kingdom only. Worldwide, it is believed to be much, much higher - at least another three times.

This is a movie that is worthwhile and can be enjoyed with your family as it also has some good humour even if it means that a certain "Mr Bharat" wants to take Shah Rukh Khan to court.

In this time of highly competitive bollywood, producing a movie like "Om Shanti Om" is nothing but a terrible mistake that affected reputation of many in the team.

Copying the western style of humour, mocking legendary artists in an unfunny way (not that I'm against imitating artists) and filling up a song with tens of famous film stars could only create the hype for this movie but the conclusion was very disappointing.

Farah Khan should take the hint and try to improve her direction skills and completely quit writing. The 6.5 rating as of yet for this movie is most probably the reason of love towards Shahrukh Khan from his fans.

This movie deserves a 4/10 from me.

Om shanti om was the blockbuster of the year and rightly so. Shahrukh Khan delivers yet another superb performance and is a shame he didn't get Best actor for this. Deepika is drop dead beautiful and she has talent, she will do good in the near future. Arjum rampal was also quite impressive as the villain of this film. Shahrukh worked hard for this film gaining a six pack in the process. The songs are lovely in this film especially Main Agar Kahoon being the best. The movie has it all action, comedy, romance, adventure and supernatural. The best thing about this is the Deewangi song where there are many superstars in one song. Salman, Saif, Sanjay Dutt and Shahrukh dancing together is a real treat. It was great to see Mithun dancing with Shahrukh as well as Dharmendra and Jeetendra.

review_title: main hoon na was much much better
review_detailed_main: I feel the movie has got more positive reviews than it actually deserved. I don't understand how the critics give their reviews on a movie. They don't have a standard approach to judge a movie. The script is full of flaws and most of the plots doesn't make any sense, but the critics overlooked them mentioning its a brainless masala entertainer. masala entertainment is fine for general public but the job of a movie critics is to watch the movie with a magnifying glass. It was the same Rajeev Masand who gave Shirish Kunder's Jaan-e-mann a thumbs down saying it has taken too much cinematic liberty and lacks a genuine script. How did he overlook the flaws in the script of his wife's movie. The plot where Shanti is killed is the main flaw of the movie. The whole murder plot and Arjun not even being suspected for it must have been written with a digestible logic. and again in the climax arjun gets killed in a more unbelievable way when he faints in middle of the hall full of people and later SRK shooting at him. This contradicts the existence of the whole plan to convict Arjun of the crime with the help of sandy as in the end SRK never proved his crime. Except for a few one liners and a couple of great comedy scenes(shooting of mind it and Filmfare awards) the movie is a drag. It just relies heavily on SRK's star power. I must give credit to Farah Khan for making a movie on the film industry but it was a let down to me since Main Hoon Na was an much better masala flick yet it had a sound script.

review_title: All the hot boys come on make some noise... Om Shanti Om

review_detailed_main:
Great movie to watch if you don't expect any stories and if u like real-nonsense fun . Many people would criticize the lack of good acting, storyline etc etc, But why need a story and blah blah .. when its so much fun without a plot. "Enna Rascalla --Mind it. " This scene is probably one of the most hilarious scenes I've ever watched (May be because I'm a big time Rajni fan too).

Deepika Padukone with all that hype surrounding her, is definitely worth a watch but probably the weakest part of the movie. This may be because every time she appears, the movie takes a slightly serious/senti turn.

Anyways, Just lock your brains and watch the movie. I'm sure you'll like it.9/10 ..

review_title: Pure enjoyment in this salute to '70's Hindi cinema...
review_detailed_main:
Growing up in 1970's India automatically implied a steady diet of Hindi masala films. They were deliciously lowbrow extravaganzas packed with songs and dances, melodrama, overwrought plot lines that were pinched from any number of sources, and amusingly huge lapses of continuity and logic. This "formula" had several practitioners, the foremost being Manmohan Desai, whose "Amar, Akbar, Anthony" had scenes of inspired looniness that remain unrivaled to this day. Of course, they were silly, but they were magnificent fun, and are all the more beloved because they date back to our childhood. It seemed the world was young and carefree, so full of promise, optimism, and potential that even the most implausible Hindi film somehow seemed credible.

Thirty years later, Farah Khan has made "Om Shanti Om", an ode to that era of Indian cinema. With great affection, the film references the blockbusters, the garish fashions (that we faithfully mimicked and thought so groovy), the stars, and the melodramatic story lines of that time. Magpie-like, Farah has filched bright and shiny objects of improbable provenance to embellish her homage to the films of her (and our) childhood. I read somewhere that she conjured up the idea for "Om Shanti Om" while she was a house-guest of Andrew Lloyd-Webber. Sir Andrew, himself a practitioner of the deliciously lowbrow, might be flattered that in her film, Farah has staged a number reminiscent of his own "Masquerade" from his long-running, yet soulless "The Phantom of the Opera". Like him, she has assigned a rather important role to a lighting fixture, and used a symphonic orchestra as back-up band (the Prague Philharmoniccertainly a first in Hindi cinema) for her hero's show-stopping finalé.

Along with these new elements, she includes nods to actors, famous films, and thanks to the magic of CGI, even a brilliant number where her leading lady sings and dances with major stars of yesteryear.

"Om Shanti Om" opens with the shooting of the 1980 Subhash Ghai hit "Karz". (Avid cinéphiles know "Karz" was "inspired" by the American film "The Reincarnation of Peter Proud".) In fact, the song "Om Shanti Om" is being filmed on Rishi Kapoor, the hero of "Karz", and Om, the background performer (junior artiste, in Hindi film parlance) hero of "Om Shanti Om", is one of the faceless members of the audience. Om's most sincere dream is to be a big star someday, and like an Indian Walter Mitty (and some clever use of CGI), he imagines himself in Rishi Kapoor's place, in a silver lamé glam-rock jumpsuit, basking in the applause and adulation of screaming fans. Om has another, just as unattainable dream: Shantipriya, the most successful and glamorous leading lady of the era. He addresses large chunks of dialogue to her gigantic beautiful visage that looms over him from a street-side hoarding for her latest film, "Dreamy Girl", oblivious to the snickers of passers-by. Along with his dreams, Om has a mother who believes he can accomplish anything, and a selfless best friend who wants nothing more than for Om to succeed. The filmi Ma and the best buddy are ubiquitous tropes of Indian Cinema, and in the hands of Kirron Kher and Shreyas Talpade, the roles are both spoofed and played straight for poignant dramatic effect.

As this is the movies, anything can happen, and does. Om finds himself having a close encounter with Shantipriya at the premiere of "Dreamy Girl". The next day he is a background-performer in a scene where the hero saves Shantipriya from a blaze. The leading man loses his nerve when the fire goes out of control, and our man Om jumps in to save the day. The two become friends. However before he can profess his love to her, things go horribly wrong, and Om perishes trying to save her life.

Thirty years later, we meet a reigning superstar of Hindi cinema, Om Kapoor, with a distinct resemblance to the deceased Om. He is spoilt, obnoxious, and oversexed, everything poor short-lived background-performer Om was not. But once his memory is given a few jolts by some staged studio fires and a visit to a derelict film studio, he realizes he is Om, reborn to avenge past wrongs.

I loved everything about "Om Shanti Om". In Farah Khan's previous film, the hit "Main Hoon Na", she had passing references to the songs and the look of the seventies. Her new opus, "Om Shanti Om" is an unabashedly shrewd and commercial film, but there is no denying that it is a full-blown love letter to the cinema of the seventies. For years, I was ambivalent to Shah Rukh Khan's work, but with "Main Hoon Na", "Paheli", "Chak De India", and even the Karan Johar NRI (Non-Resident Indian) sagas, I have become a big admirer. Success agrees with Shah Rukh Khan, the actor: he seems to try less hard to make an impression, is comfortable in his skin, and so can focus better on the character he is playing. His willingness to laugh at himself makes his screen persona that much more appealing. He is simply wonderful as the two Oms, creating two distinct characters with a single mission.

Special mention must be made of suave villain, Arjun Rampal and Deepika Padukone, the new actress who plays the '70's star Shantipriya. With her statuesque beauty and patrician elegance, she recalls Hema Malini in her heyday. In even the cheesiest settings and the most ridiculous costumes and makeup, Ms. Maliniand now Ms. Padukonewould display an innate dignity. Another star of the film is the production design. I loved the gorgeous Art Deco film studio, the film sets, the vibrant color scheme and look of the film. Great care and thought (money, too) have gone into this project, and modern film technology is used seamlessly to render the illusion all the more believable.

"Om Shanti Om" is a celebration of fun and the joy of Indian cinema: Farah Khan deservedly has a huge hit on her hands.

I have seen my fair share of Bollywood movies, and was quite anxious to see this movie in particular as it was the first Hindi movie i owned on Blu-Ray, and boy did it not upset!! Watching this movie at home i was impressed, the lavish colours, beautiful sets and awesome intentional overacting!

This movie is not meant for Filmfare awards, thats not why it was created. this is a sort of light-hearted black comedy that was created to entertain (even though it received 10 Filmfare award nods) i started watching this during a break from exam revision and ended up watching the whole thing, i just couldn't get enough.

There are more cameo appearances than one could shake a stick at, and this made the film fun for the young or old, having family members pause the movie and trying to guess who they are is just awesomely well done and sooo captivating from Farah Khan, really brings people together, and ignites the Bollywood in you.

This movie also introduces Deepika Padukone, and my gosh i could not believe this was her first movie. she was amazing, really lit up the screen when you saw how beautiful she is portraying a 70's heroine. SRK's performance and new appearance are both awesome, as hes allowed to act (and strut) his ass off, of which he does very well, and its understandable why he is crowned King Khan. all i can really say about him is "Vaah! Kya acting kar raha hai!... Vaah! Kya acting kar raha hai!"

All in all this movie is fun, exciting, entertaining and a great laugh. i highly recommend viewing this on Blu-Ray and letting those lush on-screen colours EXPLODE!!

review_title: awfully bad movie with no substance
review_detailed_main: what a disgusting movie.why do people waste so much money in making such a trash and again why do people waste so much money in watching such a trash!!!!!!!!!!!!!!mindless cheap entertainment.3hrs of who knows what!!!!all spices blended into one recipe.even the advent of a disgusting ghost at the concluded scene.whats anybody going to gain from such a crab?a money loving auspiciously incapable actor/producer only searching for even more money and some insensible uncultured fans flocking for some few hours of cheap entertainment and self-realization.the only good point of the movie.it highlights the success formula in present world.MARKETING AND MORE MARKETING.it can make u rich even without any substance.

review_title: Masala film in the best form!
review_detailed_main:
It's a bird it's a plane its mohabbat-man!! Farah Khan is back, with a movie that clearly depicts her love for Bollywood in a affectionately humorous way. Who else would have thought that someone could easily take the credit for one of the most famous quotes in Indian cinema? With Farah, everything is possible, she even has Shah Rukh wrapped around her fingers.

This movie had already made more than 100% profit even before the release of the film, the rights sold to Eros, cost 65 crore, that is a 35 crore profit from a cost of 30 crore, they could have released the movie tickets for free, but then stampedes and over-crowding of Cineplex's would incur loss in civil lawsuits against her and SRK, the producer of the film.

We see SRK playing a Junior Artist in the late 70s, the settings, and ambiance brings you back to numerous memorable (but also funny bone tickling) moments in the Bollywood industry. For those who have grown up watching those 70s and 80s movies, there are a lot of scenes you'd identify with and also roll on the floor laughing.

Newcomer Deepika is playing Hema Malini-ish heroine in the 70s, even appears with many surprises and familiar faces of that era. Our (junior) hero falls for her only to discover some surprises in the interval, and later is involves in an accident that takes his life.

'Pickar abhi baaki hai, mere dost' as we hear in the promos, the movie is yet to continue. Om is reincarnated, and 30 years later (thankfully, cos seeing SRK play his 20s is no more acceptable) we see him as an arrogant actor born to a famous filmi family (hint hint). And from here, with a series of events, (the new) Om regains his memories from his previous life, and is determined to take revenge.

This doesn't mean the second half is filled with boring dramebazi, in the 2000s we actually we to see more parody and spoof portrayed on the actors of the current era, and many references made to the current situation of Indian cinema want to know more, I guess you should catch the movie, cos Farah is a much better story teller than me!

review_title: Om Shanti Om is a major disappointment

review_detailed_main:
This movie has created probably one of the greatest hypes in Hindi Movie Industry. But that is the way things are with every time there is a Shahrukh Khan release, the entire build up is like a Mega Event and talk of the town.

Does it live up to the hype? Well... Answer is both -- Yes (if you are looking for pure entertainment), and No (if you are logical and expect every movie do be a godfather or mother India)

For starters, when i watched this movie (First day First Show). SRK and débutant deepika acted well. Other performances were also pretty good. But at the end i got the feeling that there was something in the movie which was amiss. What was it? Was the storyline a drivel.....? Well yes, it was my logical mind cropping up!! Thats the most deadly mistake you can do while watching a Bollywood Masala movie and particularly Om Shanti Om.

Hmm.. So I did a retake and watched the movie again, two weeks after its release when all the dust (of hype) had settled down. And it was an immensely enjoyable experience this time. I loved those scenes which I didn't think much first time around, the overacting mother(Kirron Kher), the convincing villain, even the horror twist to the story!

Yes Om Shanti Om is a must watch and a great cinematic effort for the following reasons: 1) How wonderfully the era of the 1970's has been re created. truly superb job. the sets, costumes, mannerisms leave you mesmerized and make you want to go and actually live in that era for a day at least! 2) This may not be SRK's best work as an actor.. BUT hats off to him for a spell binding performance. His portrayal of the 70's character, the mannerisms incorporated in acting are simply superb. the reinvention with Six Pack abs is relevant with his YO... "FISH IT, MIKEY ACT" in the second half. The King Khan carries the entire film on his shoulders. 3) The funny and light take on the Hindi Movie Industry starting right from the spoofs on legendary actors to the modern era. Its actually a film within film.

4) Natural and heart warming performances by Kirron Kher (90% Moms in India are like that only), Shreyas Talpade and Javed Sheikh (Om's Dad). Stunning debut by deepika!She has oodles of charm. Rampal makes the macho villain.

5)Some fantastic dialogues, the best one being SRK's acceptance speech of the award.

6) great music dished out.

All in all a film meant to be enjoyed and relished. PRECAUTION: Leave the logical brains out of the Cinema Hall and watch King Khan set the screen on fire..!

I have noticed that fans of bollywood movies, especially Indians, either love SRK or hate him(most of all for his mannerisms). So, if you are in the latter this movie may not "convert" you although you may still watch it for its excellent music and tongue-in-cheek humor. But, if you are an SRK fan, then this will be likely up there in your top-3 list of must-see SRK movies. it is a tour de force performance by the Khan as he shines in all departments of histrionics, and effortlessly carries the movie on his shoulders(I believe he is in every scene, not unlike most Kamalahasan movies - his Tamil superstar counterpart) - and whether he is romancing, tearing up, hamming it up or being a comic - he is at the top of his game - this movie likely represents SRK at the peak of his dramatic showmanship skills - especially his skills as a comedic actor - I believe that in the current Bollywood landscape, he is likely the best dramatic & comic actor around, bar none. The wonderful soundtrack , especially the final Broadway-operatic style climax no., as well a bright, young supporting cast does not hurt either. And of course, kudos to Farah Khan as the auteur of an endless entertaining, creative fun film unique among Hindi movies in the mad-magazine-like sense of spoofy comedy which enlivens and charms the whole movie - terrifically entertaining, two thumbs-up. As an SRK movie, it probably rates a 10. I stopped short probably only because at the end of the day it is "merely" terrifically entertaining ! A 10 is probably reserved for those magical unforgettable great ones like Sholay, that go beyond mere comic entertainment?

Yesterday after resisting myself for a long time i saw "Chak De! India" and today by chance i happened to see "Om Shanti Om". And i couldn't help comparing the two movies. But then this comment is about OSO so i will restrict myself to that. The title of this comment will tell you what i think of this movie in particular and Bollywood in general.

Agreed that SRK is a brilliant and versatile actor. Agreed that a movie need not be original to be entertaining. But shouldn't a movie have a story? And preferably a script, even if not original? OSO has none. Its a shame that the so called "power group" of Bollywood decided to make a movie but couldn't find someone decent enough who can think of a good story and write a decent script. All they could do was get all their friends together, have lots of song and dance sequences, write corny dialogs showing how good they are at spoofing and the result was OSO. It would be better if Farah Khan restricts herself to choreography.

But then the movie is making good money at the box office.People are calling it an "enternairer" and i seem to be the only fool trying to justify why i gave a two to this movie. Movies like OSO have made me stop watching Bollywood movies. But then last week i also saw an unknown movie called "The Blue Umbrella" and it reassured me that good cinema can still be expected from Bollywood.

I say 10/10 because it was really good and the plot was really good and my type of movies are like theses the cast were really fine and everything The main girl was so beautiful everything abt her was so perfect and the songs were so good I liked it.

review_title: A Parody on Bollywood that is not to be missed.
review_detailed_main:
This movie is quintessential bollywood or I should say It's a parody, a satire on filmy reality and people working in it and the issues they are facing whether it be nepotism, favouritism, actresses not getting roles after a child, starkids throwing tantrums, biased award shows and many more. It literally mocks everything including it's own creators. it is a spectacle of many events, a total Bollywood masala all crammed into one movie!! The film both pokes fun at itself and celebrates its unique, inimitable style. It offers everything that bollywood is known for in the world.

It is the story of "Om", "Shanti" and bollywood as whole. Om is a junior artist who aspires to be a main lead in a movie someday, he idolises a female star "Shanti" and wants to woo her but tragedy hits and everything gets bonkers. The songs in this are beautiful and fun at the same time. It's a Must watch if you are trynna get into bollywood.

Probably the worst trailer ever, it's nothing like the movie. The story contains it all, love, drama, comedy, action. Highly recommend.

Ignore the low ratings. This story should be a Broadway show. It's that good!

The story is subtitled in English, and the story line is based on reincarnation. I don't support or believe in reincarnation, but I mention it because it will help you follow the story.

Wow...!!! probably the dumbest movie I have ever seen... SRK Sucks.. The direction was good...poor star cast n horrible acting... Well....Was Deepika actually there in the movie?? She's hardly seen 4 20-30 minutes...and the worst part is that she won the film fare award 4 the best debut female actress! I never knew that this movie would end as a horror stuff now..Some positive aspects about the film- Deepika looks good and Arjun Rampal has proved a point. God sake I dint waste my money watching it in a theater. Real waste of time movie. Don't go by the charm. Think twice before watching any Srk movies..as its proving right these days.The Movie was a hit because of Srk and the hype created by media.Sawariya was better than this one. At least it had a story.

I never watched this movie coz didn't know how nice It can be. I gave it 8 stars actually and I am not a fan of any of the actors but Deepika here is so Beautiful and Sharukh Khan with his acting creating a beautiful connection with the audience. Also, talking about songs, this movie has one of the best albums. Ajab si song and every other song is so beautiful and energetic. A must watch.

The less known about the plot of this film going into it, the better. In brief, Om Prakash Makhija (Shah Rukh Khan), a "junior artist" at the movie studio, is in love with top actress Shantipryia (Deepika Padukone). They both meet with an unfortunate event, and are killed. Thirty years later, Om Kapoor (Shah Rukh Khan) realizes suddenly that he is the first Om reincarnated, and sets a path to avenge the death of Shanti.

Comedy and drama combine to make this an entertaining film. In addition, Om Shanti Om, makes gentle fun of itself and Bollywood movies in general, adding another level of fun. Both of Khan's performances are solid, and Padukone (in her debut role) is a confident, convincing actress. The movie is full of Bollywood big names giving special appearances and cameos --well over 50-- giving an added dimension to the movie, as the viewer tries to recognize them all. It contains impressive dance numbers, with mostly good music. Overall, while not perfect, Om Shanti Om is thoroughly enjoyable.

(Other cast members include Bindu in a small role, Kirron Kher as Om Prakash Makhija's mother, Arjun Rampal as Mukesh Mehra, and Shreyas Talpade as Pappu Master.)

review_title: AMAZING MOVIE! I've watched more than 20 times!

review_detailed_main:
SRK and FK are back after MHN with another somewhat spoofy, so-called 'masala' movie. Inspired by Karz, it's a reincarnation movie. The first half depicts the budding love-story whereas the 2nd half is more of a revenge drama.

SRK and co. are quite audacious that the movie is an out and out masala movie (whatever that means) with little or no logic whatsoever. At one point of the movie, a director boasts that he has placed three camera, one from Ray's angle, one from Bimal Roy's and the third from Guru Dutt's angle. The producer quips back to use a Desai angle, that would help the most. Ouch!! But the fact remains that even if you claim that you are deliberately overacting that doesn't help your dismal histrionics, even if you claim that you are copying past movies to pay them 'tribute' that doesn't hide the lack of creativity, even if you take the excuse that bollywood movies generally lack logic that doesn't hide the fact that your movies in certain parts is still illogical. Then there is the much talked about Filmfare award scene. Nicely done but I feel the spoofs coming on TV are at times much better even though they don't have any stars spoofing themselves.

Coming to the brighter side of the movie, Deepika Padukone looks great! (though the girl playing Dolly has better cleavage). Special effects are very well done especially the song in which some older movie scenes are seamlessly merged. The music is decent with one or two good songs. And of course there are many-many stars making guest appearances through out the movie.

On the whole, I would certainly not recommend to spend 200-300 bucks to catch it in a theater. Catch it on a rented DVD or wait for the TV release.
This movie is just one of the must watch movies! It's just classic... Just watch it once!

This movie is the same saga told over and over again. the only reason people will watch this movie is because there is SRK and Deepika Padukone, but there is no other reason to watch this movie. oh and the ending a big big disaster. Shreyas Talpade was a surprise. A complete natural, he stands on his feet all through, not getting swayed while sharing the screen space with the topmost star. Kiron Kher was delightful as usual. Arjun was an apt choice for the role he played. Deepika looked stunning. Manish Malhotra and Karan Johar have done a good job with the wardrobe.

The hype for the movie was better than the movie itself. There was no originality in the story. The script, screenplay and the direction is flawed. The dialogues are irritating. The only saving grace of the much hyped movie is the music. Main Agar Kahoon and Dard-e-Disco stand out. the three that i have given as a rating to the movie is 1) for SRK 2) For Deepika 3)The songs. if you are expecting a logical conclusion or a logical explanation to the movie don't expect one because this movie wont offer one. its a masala movie that was made for a one time watch.

review_title: excellent --- Very well done Farah & Shahrukh
review_detailed_main:
It was my choice of seeing one of the two films which were at the same hall. And the public opinion was more tilted in favour of OSO so we decided to go for it--me and my wife --we generally see movies once in a while and may be four in a year. I am so fond of movies but all the desires do not get converted into reality.

After seeing this movie I came out with a total satisfaction after a long time have seen a very good movie.. I have seen all the good movies in the market except some of the English ones.Now shall see the other one after a while.

My all the blessings are for Farah and Shahrukh for making this film a very good one.

Keep it up.

Farah dear wish you all the best for your new leaf of life--- having children -- they are the most sought property in the world for the parents.

Well done India-- Chak De India

review_title: Would have worked great as a 70s style flick......
Great film! you got to see it!
Hey I'm not going to say it was disastrous but it wasn't brilliant either!

review_detailed_main: I enjoyed it, took me one breath and it was finished i loved the numbers and coreos, that 2007 fashon grip served hands down ill try not to deep dive BUT i just gotta say that besides this being super fun, it feeds the culture of stalking, especially ON WOMEN, acting like its a normal thing, and casting....the girl was 22 at the time and srk is like 45.......im sorry srk baby boy, but u were hela hot here, i just dont like these age gaps .......songs were fire, and the scene when hes deaf mute handless legless...........

review_title: Biggest Propaganda and Worst Movie of Century
review_detailed_main:
I am a great admirer of SRK though i cant say the same for his movies.But after Chak de the hope that one day i would see SRK doing something which can be talked about across the globe got a major boost. But i guess i was in for a surprise. After Chak De ,SRK does a OSO. What a waste of time and money. There was no need for a movie like this . We watch this kind of stuff everyday on MTV and STAR TV where in they make fun of movie and people .

This movie is all about non sense things. So if u like non sense ...Go for it . This is absolute junk and don't believe the critics ,SRK and his production company has managed it.

So if u are dumb and cant judge then OSO should be ur movie.

Else go watch American Gangster.

SRK fans,Please don't take pride in being foolish. Its okei....SRK is known to make idiotic movies for his is known to fool his foolish fans..

I've had people tell me it was a waste of time of a movie, and was starting to believe that with the slow opening. Once the mystery kicked in, I forgot about lovey dovey musical opening.

I can understand why some people didn't like the movie, it is very musical , but sometimes the music plays wonderfully into the plot.

It's makes fun of the Indian cinema industry, but doesn't loose focus on the mysterious plot. Don't have high expectations. It's a great film to watch with your kids ages +6. It makes fun of some key points in cinema history.

Watch it for yourself.

I enjoyed the mystery, and of course sexy Shahrukh.

review_title: Are the makers dumb or audiences?
review_detailed_main:
I can't figure out who is more dumb? Srk takes audience for granted and Farah will keep making such worthless tributes of 70's films and people will keep going to watch such stuff Sadly this is no MAIN HOON NAA either which was at least time pass

This film is boring, boring and boring

The spoofs are dull, barring a few scenes most are so badly handled that you cringe

The first half is lifeless and can put you to sleep There is no story and no continuity in the film, the tempo keeps slowing down The interval point is also childish,

While the second half seems a watered down version of KARZ and falls flat The sudden revelation to SRK after the song DEEWANGEE looks too sudden and the climax is too stupid

Farah Khan handles the film too badly Music is good, some songs are good

Performances SHAHRUKH is unbearable here, oh i agree it's a spoof so you have to overact, but he overacts so badly in both the halves that he gets to your nerves especially in the drunken scene where he looks gay, He overacts worse in the 2nd half, dual roles are not his cup of tea Deepika shows some sparks in first half but is bad in 2nd half Arjun Rampal is good in parts Shreyas is great Kirron Kher is bad, while Javed Sheikh and the rest are OK

review_title: Wow.. fantastic job with an age-old theme of re-birth
review_detailed_main: Excellent movie ...highly entertaining ...hilarious at times !!! SRK has again proved that he is definitely the KING of Bollywood. And he seems to have really worked out for this movie. You can make out in his version of Salman's "Oh oh Jaane jaana" . And he looks good as always. And Deepika has also performed well. She looks very nice as well ! Farah Khan has a really unique style of directing where she seems to entertain the audience throughout the movie , right from the starting credits to the end credits. It surprising to think that the story is based on an old theme like re-birth. They way the movie is made around that theme is really good. And of course, one of the best parts of the movie is when SRK , as a junior artiste , is performing as a South Indian. That was hilarious. Some actors are there for a brief moment as themselves, but they are excellent and funny. e.g Abhishek Bachan , Akshay Kumar. I would definitely recommend this movie to anyone. Its a great family movie, very funny, good timepass !!!

review_title: For those who can manage to filter the 'nonsense'.....
review_detailed_main:
As much as Om Shanti Om is hyped, in media. It doesn't lives upto expectations... Well at least to mine.

To be honest, OSO started quite well. Reviving the 70s era of Indian cinema was quite entertaining and very creatively presented. I must say it made me feel that its going to be a great movie, but despite creativeness and some very well choreographed songs, I must say the 'Reincarnation' idea was not very well presented. Agreed, that the idea in the first place seemed very 'far-fetched', but then a good director can make a lame or that far-fetched idea flow well with the movie, which Farah Khan fails to do so. When compared to her previous work (Main Hoon Na), it is sad that she has not done a great job in story and plot development. However Arjun Rampal does a great job performing in his negative role, Shreyas Talpade did a good supporting actor role, not impressive but good enough, Shahrukh Khan pulls off a near or slightly above average performance (mainly due to some solid acting in some emotional scenes), while the new actress, Deepika Padukone, starts off her career in mediocre acting, but much can be expected out of her in future.

This movie, If I'm to conclude, was pure 'Masala' (for those who would just love to watch this move for the sake of cheesy and attention seeking songs with loads of guest appearances by celebrities and spiced-up special appearances). Otherwise, as one of the OSO trailers boldly says "Most entertaining Drama of the year", ironically it isn't. My rating 5/10

I just absolutely loved this movie from the start to all the way till end! I usually hate to watch the songs and skip it but surprisingly I watched each and every song of this movie and they were all excellently choreographed. Not only that but it was just fun to watch each and every song, especially the one with so many stars coming in but still all other songs were just as good as that one and also they all were directed to be looked like if I were watching a Broadway musical! It was just mesmerizing! Excellent music! Excellent acting! Excellent direction! Great story! And also there wasn't even a single second in the movie were you think that its getting boring. The sets in the movie are really relaxing to the eyes and it makes you feel not to get off your seat. It was just a very smooth movie and Deepeka Padukone is really hot! I personally think that this movie is also a contender for Top 10 Bollywood movies of all time!

Songs, dances and a few funny sequences are somewhat saving grace in the movie. Otherwise there is no story in the movie at all!!

Does Farah Khan think that Indian audience have no brains!! May be that's right. But "Kam se woh to khud thoda dimaag laga leti".

There are so many places where even a stupid person will wonder how it is possible - like Arjun Rampal gets up, and there is none in the room - earlier he was roaming with bodyguards. Etc etc. List is endless. I am sure they could have done a better job in coming up with a better story, and could have still remained funny.

Kiran Kher as usual irritating. SRK is good, but I think it is high time he starts taking better roles. Shreyas has done justice to his role.

Final recommendation, don't go and watch the movie - Save time and money.

Om shanti om is not a great film but it is an excellent entertaining. No one gets bored from beginning till the very end.

Om prakash makhija (Shah Rukh Khan) is a very successful 'junior artist', who inspires to be a hero one day. His best friend Pappu (Shreyas Talpade) supports him by praising his talent and style. Even his mother (Kirron Kher) encouraged him to be a hero by saying 'Tum ek din zaroor hero banega' (You will definitely be a hero one day). Om is madly in love with the super star of that time ShantiPriya (Deepika Padukone) and even meets her one day luckily. But unluckily after learning a secret about hers he lands in trouble.

The photography is excellent. There are many notable and catchy shots. The art direction is incredible. Lot's of effort was taken in creating the settings especially for the song dhoom Tana. Editing and sound are of notable features. Songs are stupendous. Ajab Si, deewangi, dhoom Tana are exemplary. The performances are good from all actors. Shah Rukh Khan as usual shines in his role. Arjun Rampal, Shreyas Talpade and Kirron kher did well in their respective roles. And Arjun Rampal is a wonderful villain. . The new comer Deepika Padukone is very in all aspects and she deserves all the awards she is getting. The most catchy part of this film is the song sequence deewangi deewangi where thirty one stars appear.

Go watch it!!! all those who likes Shah Rukh and entertaining films will definitely like this.

8/10

review_title: This movie is a super-hit,sans any script!
review_detailed_main: After all the pre-release drama and hype,it finally comes down to the opening night.Om Shanti Om,tipped and predicted to be the biggest blockbuster of the year,lives up to all the expectations.Earning a mammoth Rs. 19 cr. on the very first Friday,this one's sure is living up to what it was anticipated to be.Very much a Shahrukh Khan potboiler.Farah Khan proves yet again that she is better off in the choreography arena only.The movie lacks a script altogether.But having Shahrukh Khan as an ambassador can do wonders for any waste product,which he surely has done to this flick.Deepika Padukone looks stunning in this one.A nice launchpad for a Badminton champ's daughter,who's bowling over some of the cricket champs in India(not quite literally).Shahrukh Khan may be the most bankable star still,but this movie is no Swades,and so no Oscar rumours this year(and don't I thank all the Gods for that!).An entertainer throughout,go watch Om Shanti Om for fun in the evening,but don't forget to leave your brains at home!

review_title: A stroke of genius from Farah Khan.
review_detailed_main: I've watched this movie about 7-8 times in the last 14 years. It still holds up as of 2021. I'm not a fan of Farah Khan comedies/spoofs in general or a fan of SRK. But it is only fair to give credit where it is due -- I have to admit, this movie just works! Music is awesome and casting is perfect. This is not for everyone, especially for those new to Bollywood. But if you get Bollywood, you will get this movie, and likely grow to love it. Perfect blend of everything that makes Bollywood works, unabashed entertainment.

review_title: One of the Worst Climaxes I have Seen
review_detailed_main:
Almost an year back, a similar kinda movie released known as Dhoom 2. It has some striking resemblance with Om Shanti Om. First, the hype. The movies were promoted quite extremely. Second, star cast. Both featured an excellent star cast; enough to pull people to the theaters . Third, Good Music. Both Music Albums were instant hit. Fourth, Silly and Senseless Plot. And Last, Majority liked it and made (making) them blockbusters.

The major difference is that Dhoom 2 was a crap all the way while Om Shanti Om is a garbage, only in second half. I've to admit that I enjoyed first half well and was expecting something even better in second. But things got so worse in second half that I wanted the movie to end 30 minutes earlier. The climax was so terribly shown that made me question Farah Khan's ability as a movie maker.

I have no problems with the comic filmfare award ceremony and all hilarious stuff. I enjoyed it. The problem was that the scenes that demanded seriousness were also made comical. Now a 2007 actor (Om kapur aka SRK) playing a character like 'Mohabbat man' seems unacceptable. If he's a filmfare award winner superstar how can he play such roles when he later accepts in the film that he chooses his scripts carefully.

The reincarnation and revenge plots demand seriousness and creativity because you have to make people believe in things that are somewhat unacceptable. But the movie was too focused on 'destiny' that Farah Khan didn't take pain in having a good storyline. Perhaps she is intelligent enough to know that a good story and plot has no takers in Indian cinema. It is the hype and star status that sells.

Anyways, +3/5 for 1st half and -1/5 for the 2nd. This one gets 4/10 from me.

This movie was really good truly one of the best movies ever.I enjoyed this movie a lot from beginning to end.Every thing about this movie was simply fab be it the acting,music,plot.This movie has a really cool storyline and liked the way how the reincarnation was portrayed.Another thing that i liked about this was that it was very colorful movie and also the cinematography was really good.I also loved the spoofs that were made of the old 50s,60s,70s movies it was good.The music and songs were amazing the Deewangee Deewangee song which had lots of celebrities was simply sensational so was the Dard E Disco.The concept of this movie seemed very refreshing and new.The acting was extrordinary.Shah Rukh has proved himself as powerhouse performer by giving a brilliant performance in both the roles.Arjun Rampal also gave a brilliant performance and i am surprised that Vivek Oberoi was the first choice for his role.Deepika acted well in the first half but barely had nothing to do in the second half but she really stole the climax scene.Shreyas Talpade also gave a very good performance in his role also.The climax for me was shocking and also surprising.Iam also a bit shocked that many people have disliked this movie because i believe these kinda movies should be watched for entertainment purposes not for serious purposes.Skipping all that i recommend watching this movie

Although Om Shanti Om is an enjoyable at some levels, I can see why people who don't like Shahrukhkhanisms much might absolutely detest this movie.

Any one who goes to see the movie looking for logic after watching Main Hoon Na, looking at the promos or hearing a bit about the story would be kidding themselves. It does fall apart in the second half I thought... after a bit, Shahrukh Khan, Shahrukh Khan and again Shahrukh Khan in each frame becomes weary.

Instead of becoming a tribute to bollywood, which it could have pulled off, the movie becomes a tribute to Shahrukh Khan by Shahrukh Khan and his friends. For instance, we could have seen other star cast members giving more tributes to more heroes, heroines and villains of bollywood (it did happen like in a few scenes of Padukone and one tributing the villain Ajit) but it was mainly Shahrukh Khan trying to do a flick here, a flash there in an attempt to give a tribute or whatever it was.

Another aspect was the mishmash between the tribute and the wacky story. The movie tries to do two things and doesn't strike the right balance, the audience can find itself loose attention a lot of times. Farah Khan, despite all this, is an innovative director and the movie has its funny moments too. The Filmfare Awards ceremony where Abhishek Bachchan and Hrithik Roshan appear, acting arrogant was hilarious for instance. I enjoyed the movie in parts but over all, it was ordinary. 5/10.

review_title: A very fun film to watch!
review_detailed_main:
Om Shanti Om is just fantastic. Everything about this movie is great!

I just love the 1960s style and fashion, i think it is great! The films in those days were very good and Om Shanti Om is as good as them.

Actor Shahrukh Khan does a great job playing his character.

Actress Deepika Padukone is out-of-the-world playing a double role, sometime is very hard playing a double role and Deepika Padukone did a great job.

All of the other star cast were also very good/ great.

All the soundtrack in the film is great. The song with the 30+ stars is fantastic.

I review this film: 9/10! A MUST WATCH!

This shahruk khan movie is really really outstanding that any other kind of bollywood movies,i really enjoyed the full movie with out boaring a single minute,each one of us were keenly watching the movie with very interesting way.i cant forget the story even.that much of love and action in it!

review_title: Masala, but only half as spicy

review_detailed_main: Well watching this movie is just a waste of time. Shahrukh khan was just over-acting in the movie, in-short he was not at his best. People can call his one of the worst movie given by King Khan. Much hyped actress Deepika hardly have any role in the movie, may for max 25min in 3hrs movie. Some part of the movie were funny, but not enough for the people to declared it was a hit. There is no link between the Om of 1970's and Om kapoor of 2007. Some part of the movie were really irritating. But songs like Deewangi and Aakho mein tere entertained people for time being. There was no proper conclusion given to the movie. The concept of the movie was taken from blockbuster hit movie KARZ, but it was not worth for it. Advice: People Don't waste your time watching OM SHANTI OM, instead sit at home and have some delightful moment with your family and friends.........cyaaaa

review_title: Made me fall in love with movies
review_detailed_main:
This was one of the first movies I ever watched. I was 8/9 then. It made me cry, laugh, worry and celebrate at times. It still does. The feelings it evokes are so special.

The parody nature of it is quite apparent and if you're familiar with bollywood, it will make the film much more enjoyable for you. The movie made me fall in love with movies and also my favourite star ever: SRK.

Deepika has a fantastic debut. She has acted so much better in her future films but she has never looked as good. Rampal is okay. Talpade is good and his chemistry with SRK is brilliant.

Lastly I want to thank Farah Khan for making this film which had such amazing impact on me.

The 4 out of 10 all goes to Vishal and Shekhar for some good music, esp 3 songs (Ajab Si, Tumko paaya, and Jag Soona Soona Lage). Otherwise, every other dept of the movie gets a 0 out of 10. I am sorry guys. We cannot take this nonsense anymore! SRK, please give us few more of Swadesh and CHak De before you retire.

Well, Farah Khan doesn't come in the A-list of directors in Bollywood anyways, so why care! But what bothers me is the amt of limelight and buzz this kinda junk gets, just because its an SRK movie! Comedy? Its a script written, prolly mostly on the set, like one of those mindless bollywood based comedy show on any ZeTV or SonyTV.

I think its a horror movie, ya, in fact I am sure its a horror movie! I was happy with the songs, till I saw the movie today. Now the songs will haunt me, remind me of the horrific 3hrs I had! Like that song from 'Bees saal baad' - Kahin deep jale kahin dil ....!

This is one movie that is sheer perfection because it is exactly what it is supposed to be - over the top, dramatic, and a light hearted spoofy take on old world Bollywood with heartwarming characters and superb acting. Everything about this movie is spot on. Fantastic music, dialogues, and superb hamming by all actors. Hard to believe that this is Deepika Padukone's first movie as she more than holds her own against the inimitable SRK, who is at his absolute finest whether he's being silly, sensitive, or insanely dramatic. Kirron Kher is her usual superb self as the 'filmy ma', and Arjun Rampal smoother than well aged scotch as the archetypal villain. Shreyas Talpade is the real screen stealer though, for his finely nuanced performance as the hero's best friend. I love watching this one when I really want to remind myself that life doesn't have to be serious all the time, and that if things aren't okay as yet, it means 'picture abhi baaki hai mere dost!

Om Shanti Om is amazing and I could write 10000 words trying to explain the feelings and emotions it stirs in me when watching it. However I will try to keep this review shortish and to the point.

Story wise Om Shanti Om is pretty unique, it deals with reincarnation and the main character being able to remember his previous life. It also to a lesser extent deals with life after death as Shanti is revealed to come back as a ghost. The story will pull you in by Om Prakash's love for Shantipriya, a successful actress and stunning beauty who through a twist of fate he saves from a fire and befriends. Just a beautiful story with romance, suspense, horror, love and betrayal.

Casting wise what can I say besides it's Deepika Padukone and Shah Rukh Khan. Both look absolutely amazing and give jaw dropping performances especially Deepika. You won't be disappointed either by the sheer amount of cameo appearances made by other actors and actresses including Abhishek Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Preity Zinta, Rani Mukerji etc.

Song wise Om Shanti Om is filled with amazing musical numbers like the title song Om Shanti Om, Aankon Mein Teri, Dard E, Dhoom Tana, Dastaan E etc.

So what more can be said besides go watch it, itMs worth the 3hrs of your time and I'm sure you'll absolutely love it like I did. 9/10 from me and here's hoping for a number 2 where he marries Sandy xD.

There were few things those have created much hype about the movie such as first it was Shahrukh Khan movie and it is after the success of Chak De India, secondly Farah khan's second movie after Main Hoon Na, thirdly it has new heroine Deepika Padukone, fourth is hoards of star in a song and fifth is very good marketing and Diwali time which was promising a good entertainment. So after all has the movie been succeeded in entertaining the viewer?

Not as expected really. I think the movie is unimpressive remake of the Rishi Kapoor starer "Karz". As I have seen both the movie and so I can say that "Karz" was much better than "Om Shanti Om". There are few reasons for that. Though the movie seems to be good for first time viewer who haven't seen "Karz" but in real the movie is lacking good backdrop script of reincarnation. OSO has filmy background story and dull execution of it that turn out to be unimpressive. While "Karz" has very good script. Songs of OSO are not good except couple of average tracks while the music and songs of "Karz" are melodious.

The only thing that was not in the "Karz" and that is extra surprise in the OSO is hoards of stars dancing in a very good entertaining song. So over all it is an average movie showing typical Bollywood reincarnation story. Though it is quite good movie for first time viewer and good time pass for the masses but not that impressive and failed to impress the people who believe in quality cinema.

Om Shanti Om can not be considered among the Shahrukh khan's best work while Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa, Swades and Chak De India can be considered as Shahrukh khan's best work till date.

I can consider it as an average movie and give my rating as 5 out of 10.(5/10)

Diwali times in India, time for big budget movies to be released. Producers wait for this time of the year  Diwali coincides with ID. This year two movies were released  Sanjay Lila Bhansali's launch pad for two star kids  Saawariya and Farah Khan's Shah Rukh Khan vehicle  Om Shanti Om. Luckily OSO was released in Amsterdam and I did not miss that opportunity to go and see the movie.

The story starts in 1970s - Om Prakash Rakheja (Shah Rukh Khan) a junior artist in Bollywood film industry is madly in love with the dream girl star heroine Shanti Priya (debutant Deepika Padukone). After Om rescues Shanti from blazing fire during a shoot, they get to know each other. But a producer Rakesh Mehra (Arjun Rampal) whose child Shanti is bearing kills Shanti. Om tries to rescue Shanti but he too is killed by Rakesh's goons. But Om's spirit is born again as Om Kapoor (Shah Rukh Khan). In this reincarnation avatar Om is a super star himself and slowly gets to know the mystery of his previous life's killings. To find revenge he finds a girl Sandhya (Deepika again) resembling Shanti Priya to play the ghost to seek out the truth from aging producer Rakesh.

OSO is a light remake of 1970s hit movie Karz. It gives credit of that during the first shot itself by showing the Rishi Kapoor's song Om Shanti Om. The movie is quite over the top  like Director Farah Khan herself. Too loud, too jazzy, too colorful, too festive in nature  quite suitable to Indian front bencher's taste.

Shah Rukh Khan does his usual antics and succeeds. New girl Deepika is good  too tall, too slim, everything is long in her  her fingers, her nails, her legs  but a good launch pad for Deepika. She has done a good job in acting and looks. Shreyas Talpade as a side kick of Shah Rukh is okay and looks absurd with a weird wig. Arjun Rampal as a villain has acted well and reminds us of 1970s movie bad man like Pran.

There is overdoes of film actors appearing as guests; the list is long (I read about 30-35) and I would only mention a few that made me notice them  Dharmendra, Jitendra, Mithunda, Rekha, Abhishek and Akshay Kumar.

A typical Indian masala served during this Diwali may do well at box office. But movie does not have any class or finesse that Farah Khan delivered with her first debut movie Main Hoon Na.

Music is below average and songs are okay. The whole movie is shot on gaudy sets and to create laughter everyone overacts  like in old movies. It surely creates a tickle.The best feel good part of the movie when the end titles starts rolling and the whole OSO team is shown walking past the red carpet. If you like nonsense Indian Bollywood movies, this movie is surely for you during this festive season.

(Stars 5.25 out of 10)

It's srk all the way in the movie. But it's not an SRK movie. Rather we can say that this is a Farah Khan movie.

There were some funny moments but that could not be enough for the movie.

The music of the movie was outstanding. Each and every song of the movie was really awesome.

Om Shanti Om is a story based on re-incarnation and without Shahrukh in the lead role the movie would have done mediocre business. Shahrukh's been riding a wave of success and he is no doubt the King of Bollywood actors.

The first half is set in the 70s and Sharukh (Mr. Makhija) is a struggling junior artist who dreams of making it big. He dies trying to save his favorite actress Shantipriya (played by Ms.Padokone) who is killed by Mukesh Mehra (Arjun Rampal). The second half deals with re-birth, re-discovering the truth and avenging his and Shantipriya's death.

Chak De won critical acclaim and people expected Shahrukh to turn out another hit. However, in the absence of a strong star cast (with the exception of Arjun Rampal and Kiron Kher), the camera focuses entirely on King Khan. Shortly after intermission one realizes that the movie is a blatant remake of Karz!

My friend Pratibha who accompanied me was watching it for the second time and said she was bored stiff. The musical score is good but the songs are a shade too lengthy.

Shahrukh's performance is credible and laudable-if one does not leave the theater grumbling after nearly 3 hours, it is solely because of him. Deepika Padukone is average looking and does not have a lot of dialogues to her credit-she'll be better off doing supporting roles or art films. Abhishek Bachchan and Akshay amuse in their cameos.

A must watch for Sharukh Fans - Yes! Wanna watch it again - no way! Remake of Rishi Kapoor-Tina Munim starrer Karz!

review_title: A Case of All Smoke, but No Fire!
review_detailed_main: OSO has rocked in the box office, but in my opinion, it is not as good as much as it was hyped. The film, though entertaining did not fulfill my expectations. Considering SRK in Chak De!, it is a disappointing performance. Deepika certainly performed well in her debut film. Arjun Rampal and Shreyas Talpade performed brilliantly. Farah Khan's direction is commendable. I feel directing such films are tough, but she has done it beautifully. No doubt that OSO's music is the best in 2007. Vishal-Shekhar's music is too good. Backgrownd score by Sandeep Chowta too is superb. Editing by Shrish Kunder could have been better. In my opinion, SRK's 6 pack abs did the film a world of good. But OSO is certainly not as good as Jab We Met.
Too much of overacting by srk makes this less funny.
After seeing first 15 minutes of the movie I turned off my tv. Overloaded with overacting...crap movie from crap director!

This movie has a stupid reincarnation plot and also a very weird pacing with an incredibly long duration but overall its a somewhat entertaining film due to the acting, songs and visuals.

The scenes with Arjun Rampal are best.
Plz don't watch this over acting movie... What a bakwass movie ever.
